org.resthub.core.dao

Class GenericJpaDao<T,ID extends Serializable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.synyx.hades.dao.orm.GenericDaoSupport<T>
      • org.synyx.hades.dao.orm.GenericJpaDao<T,ID>
        • org.resthub.core.dao.GenericJpaDao<T,ID>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.synyx.hades.dao.GenericDao<T,ID>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractPermissionsOwnerDaoImpl, JpaGroupDao, JpaUserDao, RoleDaoImpl

    public abstract class GenericJpaDao<T,ID extends Serializable>
extends org.synyx.hades.dao.orm.GenericJpaDao<T,ID>
implements GenericDao<T,ID>
    JPA implementation of our Generic Dao that can manage any kind of entities. Extends Hades GenericJpaDao. In RESThub, we usually use generic DAO with a normal Interface/Implementation way, without the magic behaviour provided by Hades that allow to dynamically generate implementation from interface only. But you can use it if you want by adding the element to your application context.
    See Also:
    Hades 2.0 Javadoc
